definition: a feast for the eyes (idiom)/(of women) gorgeous/graceful/(of scenery) beautiful
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Beautiful scenery but meal, elegance but drink, have ulterior motives, too wonderful for words.
sentences.chinese: 秀色可餐，优雅可饮，醉翁之意，妙不可言。

definition: lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
(of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely
warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
to smell, look and taste great
